duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and execute comprehensive land acquisition plans, overseeing a portfolio of complex land acquisition projects.
Lead negotiations requiring the highest degree of discretion, technical knowledge, initiative, and judgment.
Manage the property appraisal process, including scoping, interpreting appraisal reports, and preparing necessary instruments for land and real property rights acquisition.
Coordinate with consultants providing property appraisal, land survey, environmental site assessment, and other services.
Oversee the title report examination process to identify potential title issues and coordinate with involved parties on the closing of real property transactions.
Investigate conflicts of interest and negotiate resolutions to protect Park District property.
Develop program standards, goals, and objectives in line with the Park District’s mission and Master Plan.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in real estate, economics, public administration, business administration, or a related field (Master's preferred)
